text.author: Serge Sagna, Emmanuel Bassène
text.title: Why are they named after death? Name giving, name changing and death prevention names in Gújjolaay Eegimaa (Banjal)
text.summary: This section provides details on the Eegimaa languages of Southern Senegal, their speakers and the regions in which they are spoken.
text.summary2: This paper presents the location of the Gújjolaay Eegimaa language, a Jóola language spoken in the Basse Casamance area of Southern Senegal, mainly in Mof-Ávvi, with an estimated population of 7,000-11,200 speakers, closely related languages like Kujireray/Kuluunaay and Gufiñamay, and that speakers often live in urban areas like Ziguinchor and Dakar.
